perturbation.original_text: "Invention" means any idea, invention, discovery, know-how, data, work of authorship, information, improvement, technology, process, concept or material, whether or not patentable, copyrightable or protectable as a trade secret, and whether or not reduced to practice or memorialized in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: "Invention" means any idea, invention, discovery, know-how, data, work of authorship, information, improvement, technology, process, concept or material that is both patentable and copyrightable, or protectable as a trade secret, and must be reduced to practice and memorialized in writing to be considered an invention.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflicting definition of 'Invention'. The original definition includes any idea whether or not patentable. The modified definition restricts 'Invention' to ideas that are both patentable and copyrightable or trade secret, and require a higher standard (reduced to practice and memorialized). This ambiguity makes it unclear what constitutes an 'Invention' under the agreement, affecting IP ownership and rights.

perturbation.original_text:
8.2 Termination.
(a) Dissolution or Insolvency Event. Either Party may terminate this Agreement effective immediately upon delivery of a Termination Notice if the other Party is (A) dissolved or is seeking to dissolve itself under applicable corporate law other than as part of a corporate restructuring under which its assets were first transferred to an assignee under this Agreement in accordance with Section 10.2余 or (B) (i) becomes subject to an Insolvency Event, provided that, no termination right shall exist in respect of an Insolvency Event that is a chapter 11 case under the Bankruptcy Code if the Party subject to such chapter 11 case (x) continues to perform all of its material obligations under this Agreement, (y) does not seek to reject this Agreement or take any action in such chapter 11 case to disavow or undermine the rights of the other Party under this Agreement, and (z) assumes this Agreement on or before any deadline in such chapter 11 case for such assumption余 notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing herein shall limit or prevent the Party not subject to an Insolvency Event from objecting to assumption or assumption and assignment of this Agreement or requiring cure payments or adequate assurance of future performance as a condition of assumption or assumption and assignment.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.2 Termination.
(a) Dissolution or Insolvency Event. Either Party may terminate this Agreement effective after 30 days upon delivery of a Termination Notice if the other Party is (A) dissolved or is seeking to dissolve itself under applicable corporate law other than as part of a corporate restructuring under which its assets were first transferred to an assignee under this Agreement in accordance with Section 10.2余 or (B) (i) becomes subject to an Insolvency Event, provided that, a termination right shall exist in respect of an Insolvency Event that is a chapter 11 case under the Bankruptcy Code regardless if the Party subject to such chapter 11 case (x) continues to perform all of its material obligations under this Agreement, (y) does not seek to reject this Agreement or take any action in such chapter 11 case to disavow or undermine the rights of the other Party under this Agreement, and (z) assumes this Agreement on or before any deadline in such chapter 11 case for such assumption余 notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing herein shall limit or prevent the Party not subject to an Insolvency Event from objecting to assumption or assumption and assignment of this Agreement or requiring cure payments or adequate assurance of future performance as a condition of assumption or assumption and assignment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that either party may terminate immediately, the modified text says with 30 days notice. Also, the original text states that there's no termination right if certain conditions are met, while in the modified text, it will exist regardless of the conditions. This introduces conflicting definitions of termination rights upon an Insolvency Event. The original clause states immediate termination, whereas the modified clause states termination after 30 days. This creates ambiguity regarding when the termination is effective, impacting obligations and winding down procedures.

perturbation.original_text:
10.5 Notices. All notices, requests, demands, waivers, instructions, consents and other communications to be given pursuant to the terms of this Agreement will be in writing and will be deemed to have been duly given upon receipt if delivered by hand, sent by a nationally recognized overnight mail service, or mailed by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid:
If to Stryker, addressed to:
Howmedica Osteonics Corp.
c/o
Stryker Corporation
Attn: Legal Department, [**]
325 Corporate Drive
Mahwah, NJ 07430
perturbation.changed_text:
10.5 Notices. All notices, requests, demands, waivers, instructions, consents and other communications to be given pursuant to the terms of this Agreement will be in writing and will be deemed to have been duly given 5 business days after sending by email, or will be considered delivered if there is confirmation of receipt by the recipient's system. If confirmation of delivery is not received, the original terms apply where documents will be deemed to have been duly given upon receipt if delivered by hand, sent by a nationally recognized overnight mail service, or mailed by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid:
If to Stryker, addressed to:
Howmedica Osteonics Corp.
c/o
Stryker Corporation
Attn: Legal Department, [**]
325 Corporate Drive
Mahwah, NJ 07430
perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly specified the methods of notice and when they're considered delivered, now it is ambiguously stated and creates confusion about how one should send a notice and when the delivery can be considered complete.
